New Records: New Zealand scored 215/3 in their first innings, their second highest score at Sky Stadium.
Mitchell Marsh scored 72* for Australia, becoming the Player of the Match.
Key Match Events: Australia chased down 216 runs to win by 6 wickets.
Tim David and Mitchell Marsh formed crucial partnerships to steer Australia to victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Santner won the toss and chose to bat first.
The match was the first of a three-T20 series, with both teams aiming for form before the T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh was praised for his 72* innings and leadership.
New Zealand's innings was led by Finn Allen and Devon Conway early on.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sky Stadium pitch was expected to favor batsmen, but both teams had strong bowling performances.
The match was significant for Mitchell Marsh's return to captaincy.
